meanings.definition: The quality or state of being flagrant.
meanings.sent1: The flagrance of his lies was evident to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The flagrance of the crime shocked the entire community.
meanings.sent3: Despite his attempts to hide it, the flagrance of his guilt was unmistakable.
meanings.sent4: The flagrance of corruption in the government could no longer be ignored.
meanings.sent5: The flagrance of the injustice lingered in the air long after the trial ended.

meanings.sent1: The flagrance of his disrespectful behavior was unacceptable.
meanings.sent2: The flagrance of the foul play was clear to all the spectators.
meanings.sent3: His flagrance of breaking the rules made everyone laugh at his audacity.
meanings.sent4: The flagrance of his betrayal stung like a sharp blade.
meanings.sent5: The flagrance of his arrogance filled the room, making everyone uncomfortable.
